author: Natalie Krawczyk
title: Mariska Hargitay pauses 'Law & Order: SVU' shoot to help lost child
text: [Mariska Hargitay](https://en.newsner.com/tag/mariska-hargitay/) has played a police officer on television for the past 25 years, but recently she found herself playing one in real life too when a lost child approached her thinking she was a real officer. The actress and mother of three paused filming for roughly 20 minutes while she helped the child locate their mother. A witness told [People](https://people.com/mariska-hargitay-mistaken-for-real-life-police-officer-by-young-girl-on-svu-set-8634829) that a young girl had become separated from her mother at the Anne Loftus Playground in Fort Tryon Park on April 10. The girl, appearing oblivious to Hargitay’s scene partner, Ice-T and the film crew, approached Hargitay and asked for help. Hargitay then paused production for 20 minutes while she helped the little girl look for her mother. Thankfully, the two were able to reunite in less than a half hour. Hargitay has played Olivia Benson on Law and Order: SVU since the series premiere in 1999. The show is currently in its 25th season. It looks like all those years of playing a police officer on TV paid off! Thanks to Mariska for helping the young girl find her mother. author: Tess Ryan
title: Instagram's "View Once" Feature Will Now Actually Prevent People From Sharing Your Photos
text:
On social media, we open ourselves up to the world. Unfortunately, some people in that world have malintent. Particularly vulnerable to social media scams are image-focused platforms like Instagram. To combat a rising issue of image extortion, Instagram is rolling out new safety features as of today.
Instagram Is Adding New Safety Features to Prevent Image Abuse
Announced today via Meta's Newsroom, as part of a collaboration with the National Center for Missing and Exploited Children (NCMEC) and Thorn, Instagram will now put new measures in place to prevent crimes like "sextortion" and "intimate image abuse." These types of scams often target younger, teen users and involve the threat of distributing an intimate photo unless payment is received—or, extortion.
Instagram's new measures include protecting disappearing images from being captured by screenshots, monitoring follow requests, and nudity censorship.
Disappearing Image Protection
A feature rolling out "soon" to all Instagram users will be the inability to take screenshots or screen records of ephemeral images. These are photos or videos sent with the "view once" or "allow replay" feature within Instagram DMs or the Messenger app.
Previously, if you sent a disappearing message to someone, they could capture it with a screenshot, and you would be notified that they did so. However, if you try to take a screenshot of a disappearing image now, you'll just capture a black screen with an Instagram notification letting you know you "can't screenshot or record this."
Follow Requests and Follower Lists
Starting today, Instagram will also start flagging profiles that have certain qualities representative of scams, such as newly created accounts. When those profiles send follow requests to teen users, Instagram will block or move the request to the spam folder. For any accounts that slip through the cracks, Instagram may also send teens an alert, such as if the user they're talking to is located in a different country.
Additionally, as lists of followers and following have previously been leveraged in extortion tactics, Instagram will also block those lists from accounts it flags for "scammy behavior."
Nudity Censorship for Teens
Following Instagram's roll-out of Teen Accounts last month, the platform will now apply one of its beta safety measures to all Teen Accounts, as well as offer it as an optional feature to all users worldwide. Instagram's nudity detection feature blurs images that the algorithm deems as containing nudity in Instagram DMs.
Additional Crisis Resources
Safety features can only go so far, and unfortunately criminals will find ways to work around such protections. For this reason, Instagram is providing additional resources, such as integrating a Crisis Text Line for US users to reach out to when they suspect scams.
However, a resource like a text line only works when people know to ask for help. To combat the potential embarrassment or avoidance of reaching out for help, Instagram has worked with the NCMEC and Thorn to create an educational campaign, including a video documenting red flags and best practices.
Sadly, it seems this vicious crime is on the rise, with "reports of online enticement increasing by over 300% from 2021 to 2023," according to the NCMEC. Of course, social media is ripe for scams, but as long as you know what to look for, you can typically avoid them. Education is key, and I'm pleased to see a social media heavyweight like Meta putting effort into not only features, but resources to equip its users with knowledge.

author: Salman Akhtar
title: Turkish and Greek Navies Collaborate in NATO's Exercise Ariadne-2024 in Aegean Sea
text:
The naval forces of Türkiye and Greece recently showcased their commitment to regional security and cooperation by participating in a NATO mine countermeasure training exercise, dubbed Exercise
Ariadne-2024. Conducted in the strategic waters of the Aegean Sea, the event underscored the importance of allied naval powers working in unison to enhance mine countermeasures capabilities within the military bloc.
Strengthening NATO's Maritime Security
The exercise, which took place on March 2, saw the participation of Türkiye's minehunter
TCG Anamur and Greece's HS Evropi, both integral members of Standing NATO Mine Countermeasures Group 2. This annual event is pivotal in improving the interoperability and effectiveness of NATO forces in detecting and neutralizing sea mines, a critical aspect of maritime security that ensures the safe passage of civilian and military vessels in international waters. Through exercises like Ariadne-2024, NATO aims to bolster its collective defense and deterrence capabilities, particularly in regions of strategic importance such as the Aegean Sea.
Fostering Cooperation Amidst Regional Rivalries
The participation of Turkish and Greek naval forces in this exercise is particularly noteworthy, given the historical tensions between the two nations over territorial disputes in the Aegean Sea. However, their collaboration within the framework of NATO exercises such as Ariadne-2024 highlights a shared commitment to regional stability and the safeguarding of critical maritime routes. This cooperative spirit is crucial for the effectiveness of collective defense measures and for maintaining a unified front against common threats.
The Significance of Exercise Ariadne-2024
Exercise Ariadne-2024 represents more than just a routine training operation; it is a testament to the adaptability and cohesion of NATO's naval forces in responding to evolving maritime threats. By focusing on mine countermeasures, the exercise addresses one of the most insidious dangers to naval operations and international commerce. The successful completion of such drills enhances the alliance's readiness and capability to manage and mitigate the risks associated with naval mines, thereby contributing to global maritime security.
As Türkiye and Greece continue their collaboration within the NATO framework, Exercise Ariadne-2024 serves as a beacon of cooperation, demonstrating the potential for mutual understanding and joint action even amongst nations with complex histories. The enduring significance of these drills lies in their ability to foster a culture of collaboration and preparedness, ensuring that NATO remains a formidable force in maintaining peace and security in the maritime domain.

author: Rochelle Olson
title: Vice President Harris makes historic visit to Planned Parenthood in St. Paul
text:
Vice President Kamala Harris made a historic stop at Planned Parenthood's St. Paul facility with Gov. Tim Walz on Thursday in an election-year effort to underscore the commitment of President Joe Biden to reproductive care.
The vice president's office said the visit marks the first by a sitting president or vice president to a clinic that provides abortions, but Harris emphasized the broader scope of care provided there.
"Please do understand that when we talk about a clinic such as this it is absolutely about health care and reproductive health care so everyone get ready for the language: uterus," she said. "That part of the body needs a lot of medical care, people."
Harris briefly toured the facility with Walz, Dr. Sarah Traxler, chief medical officer of Planned Parenthood North Central States; Ruth Richardson, Planned Parenthood's regional president and CEO; and U.S. Rep. Betty McCollum, who represents the area.
The vice president stopped for a few minutes to talk to the reporters packed into the reception room and drive home the administration's commitment to restoring the abortion protections the U.S. Supreme Court scrapped when it overturned Roe v. Wade in 2022.
She thanked the clinic employees, Walz, McCollum and St. Paul Mayor Melvin Carter for maintaining access to care. She denounced restrictions in other states that prevent women from obtaining similar care "within any reasonable distance" of their home.
"I've heard stories of and met with women who've had miscarriages and women who were being denied emergency care because the health care providers there at an emergency room were afraid that, because of the laws in their state, that they could be criminalized, sent to prison for providing health care," she said.
"So I'm here at this health care clinic to uplift the work that is happening in Minnesota as an example of what true leadership looks like," she added.

author: Rita Lebleu
title: Winter Warming Center to open Sunday
text: Winter Warming Center to open Sunday Published 11:09 Beautiful. That is the word Joanne Coleman, SC3, used more than once to describe the community’s response to helping meet the needs of the homeless in anticipation of sub-freezing temps. Individuals, businesses, industry, churches and other nonprofits responded to a list posted by SC3 earlier this week when the Sulphur nonprofit announced its Winter Warming Center, 501 E. Burton St., in Sulphur, will open 6 p.m. to 7 a.m. beginning Sunday evening, Jan. 14. In addition to donations the endeavor includes the Open Door Biker Church, Freedom 337, Empowerhouse Ministries, Sulphur Community Church and Care Help. “Helping others, serving, that’s part of being a Christian,” Coleman said. “I think people want to help, but knowing how to help and helping in the right way is never easy.” Givers shared funding, food, jackets, blankets and other supplies. Volunteers who will help operate the warming center have been trained in advance. “Knowing how to help and helping the right way is never easy,” Coleman said. “You have to love people where they are.” Typically, SC3 serves the homeless Monday through Thursday, 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. The following items are sought to supply the overnight warming center and future efforts to shelter the neighbors with no homes: new pillows and pillow cases, heavy blankets, lap blankets, coffee, creamer and sugar, individually packaged snacks, pre-packaged breakfast items, canned or bottled drinks, paper plates and plastic utensils, trash bags (15 and 55 gallon), sanitizing products, flashlights and batteries, jackets and sweatshirts, new mens and womens underwear, winter hats and gloves, dog kennels, leashes and food, laundry detergent and small heaters (for homes), Financial donations are used to fill any gaps. Items can be shipped to or dropped off at 501 E. Burton St., Sulphur, LA, 70633, M-Th, 8 a.m. to 2 p.m.

author: sina_mobile
title: 农资为墨润沃野 服务作笔绘丰年 --中国海油保供春耕助力端稳"粮食饭碗"_手机新浪网
text:
农资为墨润沃野 服务作笔绘丰年 ——中国海油保供春耕助力端稳“粮食饭碗”
春耕是全年粮食生产的关键起点，承载着全年丰收的希望，是保障粮食安全、端稳“中国饭碗”的关键之战。
中国海油作为国内重要的化肥生产供应商，早谋划、早部署、早行动，从南到北，在农资供应的各个环节持续发力，多措并举助力春耕春播顺利开展，为守护粮食安全防线贡献力量，让保障粮食安全的政策红利切实转化为田间地头的丰收硕果。
海油担当“筑”满仓 “链”环发力促春耕
南有“富岛”化肥似甘露，北有叉车转运忙，中国海油以稳定的产能、贴心的服务，全力保障农资供应，在大地上精心绘制春耕图景。
海南省春光无限，中海化学富岛公司化肥二部生产现场一片繁忙。轰鸣的机器声中，包装人员忙碌地进行装车作业，货运卡车里印有“富岛”标识的金黄色化肥袋格外醒目。
作为中海化学三大化肥生产基地之一，富岛公司具有132万吨/年大颗粒尿素、140万吨/年甲醇和8万吨/年复混肥的生产能力，通过稳定的产能输出，源源不断地为农业生产输送关键物资，确保春耕时节肥料充足供应。富岛公司还与海南省工业和信息化厅建立“一对一” 联系机制，以及时掌握需求端动态。
农机的轰鸣声是丰收的前奏，油品的稳定供应是农耕人踏实的依靠。
2月12日，中海炼化华东销售四川公司绵竹富新加油站接到了一通紧急电话。电话那头，是富新加油站里的老熟人李伯焦急的声音，正值春耕之际，他的插秧机缺油无法启动，十亩农田亟待耕耘。加油站经理孙浩立即回应：“别急，我马上送油来！”孙浩第一时间将柴油送达田间，随着农机重新鸣响，沉寂的田野焕发出勃勃生机。
2024年9月以来，中海炼化华南销售惠州公司东江加油站启动“油惠田间·服务暖心”专项行动，开通24小时散装油品绿色通道。无论是凌晨抢灌稻田，还是深夜抢修农机，为满足农户紧急用油需求，站内员工随时做好准备。截至2月下旬，东江加油站累计供应散装油品超过40000升，用行动诠释“海油温度”，全力保供春耕，解决农户燃“油”之急。
北方还未嗅到春天的气息，备肥行动已经逐步拓展开来。天公不作美，2月15日，中海化学华鹤公司迎来春节后第一场降雪，最低气温降至零下23摄氏度。为保障春耕期间化肥及时供应，华鹤公司在岗员工积极应对，一方面组织人员清雪，另一方面同步开启24小时不间断巡检模式。
合理规划仓库布局提高利用率，建立库存预警机制，根据市场需求和生产进度及时调整库存水平……华鹤公司复合肥部汪洋介绍，早在春节前，复合肥项目组就收集了农户差异化用肥需求。如今，一袋袋尿素等化肥通过全自动包装线、高位码垛机和机械手臂码垛机等工具码垛、装车。厂区内外,悬挂着黑龙江各地车牌的卡车有序排起了长队，等待装载。
2024年化肥冬储期间，中海化学大峪口公司一期复合肥装置实现“长周期”运行。该生产装置在2024年11月连续13天日产尿基复合肥超1000吨，创历史新高。今年春节期间，大峪口公司生产不停，生产装置满负荷运转，包装化肥1.6万吨。
为缩短化肥运输距离，大峪口公司积极与铁路企业开展合作。“大峪口公司一年生产总量约100万吨，其中铁路运输量占总运输量的70%左右。为提高效率，我们将包装车间直接与铁路站口相连，化肥能更快发往全国各地。”大峪口公司储运部发运管理岗张志雄介绍道。
在铁路站口，蒋春蕾等人正熟练地驾驶叉车，将一袋袋复合肥从站台运至火车车厢，送上销往全国的旅程。叉车在站台与火车之间来回穿梭，发动机的鸣响声与对讲机里的指令声交织在一起，构成了一幅紧张而有序的工作画面。
“我们制订了详细的轮班表，每个人都随时待命，”蒋春蕾指着身后数万袋等待运输的复合肥和望不到头的车厢说，“目前，厂区每天的出货量可以达到3000多吨。”
此外，作为中国海油旗下重要的磷复肥生产基地，大峪口公司通过产、供、销各环节紧密配合，以产量作为后盾，将“保供稳价”作为首要任务，制订阶段性工作目标激励全员，切实保障春耕磷肥供应。
硫黄同样是生产磷肥的重要原料。中海炼化强化农资原料配置，加强统筹生产组织，保障装置稳定运行，日产硫黄约200吨。
科技小院挥创新之斧 特色领域供增收方案
扎根琼岛热壤，让科研成果落地成金，科技小院正逐步成为海南农业创新的“孵化巢”，用技术羽翼托起特色作物增产增收的希望。
海南省四季水润，凭借先天优势，近年来在热带植物与新兴特色水果的培育发展上一路“高歌猛进”。
在海南省农业农村厅的积极推动下，中海化学与高校强强联手，签订科研项目合作协议，实现科技助农“零距离”，加快形成农业新质生产力。
1月18日，海南乐东燕窝果科技小院金黄的燕窝果上市了。燕窝果在国内属于“稀罕”水果，因其产量有限、营养价值高、采摘和运输难度大等原因，在市场中属于中高价水果。此前，该地出产的燕窝果产量低、单果重量轻。科技小院围绕燕窝果全生育周期进行研究，采用“生物+有机+无机+水溶肥”的营养技术方案，显著提高了燕窝果的坐果率和产量。“果子好看还更甜了，肯定能卖个好价钱。”农户王洪金说。
科技小院让科研成果能够更直接、更有效地应用到农业生产一线。科研人员和农户同耕共研，填补了更多热带特色作物营养技术的空白，让丰收梦照进现实。
2024年，五指山大叶茶科技小院扎根五指山市水满乡新村。海南五指山大叶茶历史悠久，可追溯至1500年之前。海南热带雨林，以其高海拔的独特地势与纯净无污染的生态环境，成为大叶茶生长的不二之选。
面对因降雨频繁导致的茶树病虫害严重问题和茶叶产量、品质提升困难的情况，科技小院驻点师生实地调研，研究出一套生态防治病虫害的方法：利用害虫天敌进行生物防治，减少化学农药使用，保护当地生态环境；同时，根据土壤检测结果和茶树生长阶段，制订个性化施肥方案，增强茶树自身抵抗力。经过一年实践，采用这些方法的茶园病虫害发生率降低25%，茶叶产量逐步恢复，品质也有所提升。茶多酚和氨基酸含量增加，口感更醇厚，茶叶价格随之上升，茶农收入得到显著提高。此外，科技小院还不定期组织专家现场培训，为茶农传授科学种植和管理知识，帮助茶农提升技术水平。
早在1995年，中国海油旗下的中海化学就与五指山市结缘。2022年，为巩固脱贫攻坚成果，中海化学与五指山市水满乡政府在水满乡新村什巾岭共同打造了标准化精品生态茶园。茶园面积约40亩，投入资金约200万元，集茶叶种植、旅游观光、农事体验、研学教育于一体。一系列助农行动助力大叶茶走出五指山，大叶茶品牌逐渐成为海南促进乡村振兴、实现产业兴旺的特色抓手之一。
在琼海，黄晶果科技小院科研人员深入田间地头，针对黄晶果养分周期管理研究近乎空白的现状，研究优化施肥时间和用量；保亭红毛丹科技小院通过改良土壤结构、合理灌溉等综合措施，有效提高红毛丹的坐果率和果实甜度；豇豆科技小院经过为期一年的试验、施肥、采样分析和测产，进一步提高豇豆的施肥效果……2023年9月以来，中海化学已参与开展海南省10种特色作物的科学施肥体系研究，目前已参与建成琼海黄晶果、五指山大叶茶、保亭红毛丹等6个科技小院。
海油电商铺“云路” 惠农资源至沃野
“海油惠农宝”横跨数字云海，将优质农资与贴心服务送抵农户身旁，让便捷与高效在田野间绽放。
在数字化浪潮的席卷下，农业服务领域也在不断探索创新。中国海油紧跟时代步伐，积极利用电商平台拓展服务渠道，致力于为农民提供更加便捷、高效的服务，助力农业现代化发展。“海油惠农宝” 电商平台，已成为农民与优质农资产品、专业农业服务技术之间的重要桥梁。
“海油惠农宝”平台的商品种类极为丰富，涵盖各类化肥产品，无论是粮食作物还是蔬菜水果等经济作物的种植用肥需求都能在这里得到满足。农户只需通过手机或电脑登录平台，就能选购所需农资，告别了以往四处奔波采购农资的繁琐，实现了买肥省时省力更省心。
在宁夏回族自治区固原西吉县，中海化学电商专员牛宇翔负责“海油惠农宝”平台推广工作。在推广过程中，他发现当地很多种植户由于对肥料特点了解不够，在选择肥料时常常感到迷茫。
“只有让农户真正了解肥料的特性和适用范围，才能帮助他们科学施肥，提高农作物产量和质量。”明确了目标，牛宇翔在推广平台的同时，细致地向农户讲解肥料的相关知识，并根据当地的土壤条件、气候特点以及农户种植的作物种类，为他们推荐合适的肥料产品，详细介绍使用方法和注意事项。在他的努力下，越来越多农户开始信任并使用 “海油惠农宝” 平台购买化肥，享受到便捷的服务和优质的产品。
为进一步优化农资配送流程、降低运输成本、提高配送效率，“海油惠农宝”以签约E店、E员的方式，实现在一定区域范围内多家用户由E店和E员协助拼单整车发运，解决散单在西北大地难以发运的难题。这一模式不仅减少中间环节，还大大缩短了配送时间，让农户能够及时用上所需农资。

author: APA
title: Putin's foreign intelligence chief vows to prevent foreign meddling in presidential election
text: President Vladimir Putin's foreign intelligence chief Sergey Naryshkin said in a video released on Friday that Russia's spies should make every effort to prevent any foreign meddling in the March presidential election, [APA](https://apa.az) reports citing Reuters. Putin announced this month, in comments made to soldiers, that he would run in the election. "An important political event will take place in the New Year - the election of the President of the Russian Federation," Sergei Naryshkin, head of Russia's Foreign Intelligence Service (SVR), said in the video clip. "We must make every effort to prevent possible attempts at external interference." Opposition politicians say the election represents "just a fig leaf of democracy to cover up what they see as a corrupt dictatorship in Putin's Russia." Supporters of Putin dismiss that analysis, pointing to some independent polling that shows he enjoys approval ratings of above 80%. They say that Putin has restored order and some of the clout Russia lost during the chaos that accompanied the collapse of the Soviet Union in 1991.

author: VNExplorer
title: Ireland weather: Washout weekend forecast as temperatures dip before major shift
text:
The coming days are set to be a washout with heavy showers, hail and thunder before a major U-turn.
Met Éireann has said the weekend will be unsettled and rather cool for the time of year, as a mix of sunshine and showers start off the days before bands of rain sweep across the country bringing heavy rain as well as hail, thunder and even spot flooding.
As well as rain, temperatures are set to drop on Friday and some wintry falls are possible and a touch of frost is likely in some sheltered spots while the mercury dips to between 1C and 4C. Some wintry falls are also possible on Saturday night.
Although Sunday will start out dry, rain will extend nationwide in the evening with heavy falls pouring down on the country. Monday will be quite the same, some heavy falls are possible with the chance of some spot flooding.
Thankfully, Tuesday mostly signals the end of the wet few days and is expected to bring a good deal of dry weather but there will be some showers.
However, Alan O’Reilly from Carlow Weather has warned that rainfall amounts could vary between forecasts for next week. He wrote: “Low pressure in control next week but positions of low systems vary on the two models. This means rainfall amounts will vary a lot across forecasts and apps etc.”
Here is Met Éireann’s forecast for the weekend:
Friday Fresh and increasingly breezy today with a mix of sunshine and showers. Showers will mainly affect western and northern areas at first, but will spread across the country during the day on a strong westerly breeze.
Some of the showers will be heavy with hail and the slight chance of lightning. Later in the day, showers may turn wintry on high ground. Highest temperatures of 7C to 10C.
Cold and windy on Friday night with a mix of clear spells and showers, some of the showers will be heavy and prolonged with hail and thunder possible.
Some wintry falls are possible, mainly over the hills. Lowest temperatures of 1C to 4C in fresh to strong westerly winds. A touch of frost is likely in some sheltered spots.
Saturday Saturday will be a fairly windy day with a mix of sunny spells and showers with the continued chance of hail and thunder. Some wintry falls are possible in the morning on high ground. Highest temperatures of 7C to 10C, but feeling colder in a fresh to strong northwest breeze.
Cold and breezy on Saturday night with clear spells and scattered showers. Lowest temperatures of 2C to 5C with fresh and gusty northwest winds, moderating later in the night.
Sunday Sunday will start out dry in most areas with just the odd shower. However, rain will develop in the southwest during the morning, spreading across Connacht, Munster and south Leinster by afternoon.
Rain will then extend nationwide in the evening. Highest afternoon temperatures of 8C to 11C with mostly light and variable breezes at first but a freshening southerly breeze will develop later on.
Widespread outbreaks of rain on Sunday night with some heavy falls. Lowest temperatures of 5C to 9C with moderate to fresh south or southeast winds.
It will be a cloudy and wet weekend
Monday It looks set to be a cloudy and wet day on Monday with outbreaks of rain. Some heavy falls are possible with the chance of some spot flooding.
Maximum temperatures of 8C to 11C in moderate southeast or variable winds. Rain is expected to ease on Monday night with good dry and clear spells developing. Lowest temperatures of 3C to 6C in a moderate northeast breeze.
Tuesday Tuesday is expected to bring a good deal of dry weather overall but there will be some showers, especially over the northern half of the country.
The best of the sunshine is likely in southern and southeastern counties. Maximum temperatures generally ranging from 10C to 13C but a little cooler in the northeast with a moderate northeast breeze.
Largely dry on Tuesday night with clear spells. Lowest temperatures of 3C to 7C in moderate southeast winds.
